title: Data Types (Different Kinds of Data)
simplifierConcept:
Data types are like different containers:

üî¢ NUMBERS: int (whole), double (decimals)

Just like:
‚Ä¢ Water bottle holds liquids
‚Ä¢ Box holds solid objects

Each type has a purpose!

int: Counting (age, quantity)
double: Measurements (price, height)
string: Words (name, address)
bool: Yes/No decisions (isStudent, hasLicense)

Think: Choose the right container for your data!

syntaxBreakdown.explanation: Whole numbers only: -100, 0, 42, 1000. No decimals! Range: -2 billion to +2 billion.
Numbers with decimals: 3.14, 19.99, -0.5. More precise than int for measurements.
Text in quotes. Any characters: letters, numbers, symbols, spaces. "Hello 123!" is valid.
Only two values: true or false (lowercase!). For yes/no, on/off, enabled/disabled situations.

challenge.instructions:
Create a game character profile!

1. Create variables:
   - Character name (string)
   - Health points (int)
   - Attack power (double)
   - Is alive (bool)
   - Level (int)

2. Display all character stats
3. Use string interpolation to create a summary

Example: "Knight (Level 5): 100 HP, 15.5 ATK, Status: Alive"
challenge.hint: int for whole numbers (health, level). double for decimals (attack). string for text (name). bool for true/false (isAlive).
commonStickingPoints: Using wrong type: int price = 19.99; ERROR! int can't hold decimals. Use double. int quantity = 5; OK!
Bool capitalization: bool isReady = True; ERROR! Must be lowercase: true or false, never True/False.
Quotes on numbers: int age = "25"; ERROR! Numbers don't use quotes. string age = "25"; works but age is text, not a number!
Mixing types: int x = 5; string y = x; ERROR! Can't directly assign int to string. Need conversion (covered later).
